intro: Triaspis chorigyna, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, compact shrub with thick, fleshy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including shades of purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Triaspis chorigyna thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
